feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 10:46AM AKST until January 01 at 8:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Visibility as low as one half mile. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta Coast.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued January 01 at 10:46AM AKST until January 02 at 5:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches with highest amounts in Adak. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. Visibility reduced to one half mile or less at times.

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued January 01 at 10:07AM AKST until January 03 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...East to southeast winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Bristol Bay. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning.

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued January 01 at 5:38AM AKST until January 04 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Winds will gust as high as 55 mph. Blowing snow will reduce visibility to near zero at times. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST Thursday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 4:17AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS DEVELOPING WITH SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW CHANGING TO RAIN TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... A strong low pressure system is poised to move along the Aleutian Chain Tuesday morning before entering the southern Bering Sea Tuesday evening and overnight. Easterly to east-northeasterly winds will pick up Tuesday morning and peak with gusts to 60 mph

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 12:00PM PST until January 04 at 4:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM TUESDAY TO 4 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Snow accumulations of 4-10 inches in the Sierra Nevada. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 1:14PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SLICK TRAVEL EXPECTED INTO THIS EVENING... Snow showers will result in a coating to around an inch along Skyline Drive through this evening. This will likely lead to slick roads, especially above 2,500 feet elevation. The snow showers are expected to remain generally north of US-33. Remember that bridges usually freeze before roads. entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge
